Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: RLJones
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my D60.  I really wanted the D5100 but couldn't afford it.  It has all of the basic features I wanted but is missing the additional resolution of the D5100, 14.2 Meg vs 16.2 meg, and the adjustable screen which is OK.  The most important thing to me is that it uses all of my lenses and attachments I had for the D60 and uses them as well or better than the D60.  It's a very nice camera.It takes very nice HD video.  It is limited to 10 minutes but when you think about it thats a pretty long video.I'm glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: D3100 is missing some features I loved about the D5000....
Reviews.Author: LJH
Reviews.Content: I already own a Nikon D5000 and ordered the D3100 because of it's lower light capability and better HD video capability.  HOWEVER, I was disappointed that some of the features I loved about the D5000 have been omitted with the D3100.  The D3100 has no "scene" mode - ideal settings for beach, snow, autumn leaves, pets, etc.  This mode was replaced with a "guide" mode... not needed if you refer to the manual and if you are familiar with the camera.Also, regarding my order, Cameta Camera stated that the camera, (body only), "includes ALL original camera accessories (the Nikon USA Warranty Card, Batteries, Cords, Instruction Manuals, etc.)" but NO cords were shipped with the camera.  I will contact Cameta Camera about this.

Reviews.Title: A Powerful, Small and Light Weight Camera
Reviews.Author: Kimball Corson
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewer who indicates the features lacking on this camera, including the warranty card from Calumet; however, those features are not ones I care about, want or use anyway (except the warranty card), especially the folly of video in a still camera. What I wanted was exactly what I got: the new Expeed 2 image processing engine found in the top end Nikon D3S and D7000 cameras, a new 14.2 MP CMOS (not a CCD), a very small size and a very light weight, without being flimsy or junky.My complaint on professional gear and I have some is that it is too big and too heavy and it scares small children and others in the Third World. However, I want the high end picture making capabilities and muscle of the top professional gear in a light weight and small walk around camera and lens. That is what the D3100 is all about, plus, for the body only, it is still tremendous bang for the buck, especially when then used with a super standard zoom lens like the Nikon 16-85mm (forget the 18-200mm with its problems which I have also reviewed here).

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Tushar Shah
Reviews.Content: I got around to writing review after more than a year since buying this camera. It meets my needs perfectly because I was looking for light-weight camera that gives good results indoors and has low shutter-lag. Indoor photos don't washout the subjects with excessive flash allowing natural skin tones to show. Shutter lag is low enough for capturing fleeting smiles. Size and bulk is small enough to hang on the neck or carry in a backpack.Most of my pictures are taken in Auto-mode but I love the results. Only once I fiddled around with manual focus, ISO and Aperture settings for 4th of July fireworks. Pictures I got were magazine-worthy.Battery life is long enough for over 400 shots, 16GB card is sufficient for lasting over couple of trips. I use Picasa for organizing photos and Sony's PMB for importing.I skipped buying the kit from Costco because I know I would not carry around two different lenses, let alone switch them. Instead I bought 18mm-105mm lens and thank my good judgment every time I use my camera. Lens is good enough for wide angles and perfect for portraits. Bokeh effect is as expected (can never get that from even high-end aim-and-shoots). I have taken shots of rainbows, closeups of kids, super close-ups of flowers, city-life, dance performances, beaches, sunsets and whatever else I fancy.I have never felt buyer's remorse for owning this. I just thought it is worth the expense to capture priceless memories of my kids before they grow up. I only wish D3100 had adjustable LCD like D5100's for taking ground-level photos or other unusual angles.

Reviews.Title: great versatility!
Reviews.Author: happy photographer
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly happy with this camera!  First off, the ability to buy just the camera body was very helpful, as it saved me about $50 on the kit 18-55mm lens, which I was able to put towards a 18-105mm lens.  The camera itself works really well in a number of conditions.  It has a really high max ISO, so you can shoot inside without flash and with high enough shutter speeds to prevent blur.  Outside I was able to capture some great shots of sports games, where the "series" option and high shutter speed proved very helpful.  If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive digital SLR camera, and are willing to drop a couple more bucks for a better lens/already have other Nikon lenses you can use, this is the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics and Video with old Nikkor manual film lenses.
Reviews.Author: Book Reader "bob_spez"
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a DSLR for years. Every time I hear the word Nikon, I hear Paul Simon's 50 year old lyrics playing loud and clear in my head... "I've got a Nikon camera, I love to take photographs, Mama don't take my Kodachrome away."I have a Panasonic Lumix LX5 that I bought on Amazon about a year ago that takes great pics and videos in auto or manual mode. Recently I have been experimenting with setting f stops and exposure and ISO settings in manual mode on the Lumix. I found I could get even better pics with manual settings than just using the auto settings. I started to desire a bigger sensor and more megapixels, to get even better pics, but wasn't comfortable spending many hundreds or thousands on a new DSLR and quality lenses.On ebay I just bought a used Nikon D3100 body and four used Nikkor manual film lenses for less than 400 dollars total. To take pics or videos, I set the f stop on the lens, set the exposure on the D3100, keep the ISO on 100, turn the manual focus ring on the lens, and shoot amazing videos and still pics outdoors, or indoors in room light with no flash.In the used market, many 30 to 40 year old Nikkor film lenses are selling for 10% of what they cost new. These are designated Non-AI or Pre-AI lenses, and they worked with Nikon film cameras. They are solid lenses and perform incredibly well with the D3100 in manual mode, for stills and video, thanks to the magnify (+) and (-)  buttons on the left side of the D3100 lcd screen.  When setting up a still shot or a video with the lcd screen in live view, using the magnify buttons digitally magnifies a portion of the screen up to 6.8 X, so I can focus perfectly by turning the focus ring on the lens until the magnified image on the lcd screen is sharp. I can't read a pill bottle, even with my glasses on, but this magnify button blows up a portion of the image so I can focus perfectly with the lens focus ring. And the screen also shows the exposure time and iso settings. The f stop is set with a ring on the lens itself.The DX sensor on the 3100D increases the 35mm equivalent of lenses by 1.5. My Nikkor film lenses and 35mm equivalents are:Nikon Nikkor-Q Auto 200mm f/4.0 1:4 Manual Focus Telephoto Lens (35mm equivalent of 300mm).Nikon Zoom-Nikkor 43-86mm f3.5 Non-AI (35 mm equivalent of 64.5-129mm).Nikon Nikkor-H Auto 28mm 1:3.5 Manual Focus Prime Lens (35mm equivalent 42mm).Nikon F 50mm f/1.4 Nikkor S Non-AI Film Camera Prime Manual SLR Lens (35mm equivalent of 75mm).

Reviews.Title: Is Amazon aware of what Nikon calls "Gray Market"
Reviews.Author: Nestor J. Portillo "newbie"
Reviews.Content: Since I moved to US 10 years ago I acquired the discipline to register any new product at the site manufacturer to ensure authenticity, guarantee, service, etc.This time was not an exception, and when trying to register my new D3100 at the nikonusa.com site I got a message that states that my purchase falls into what Nikon calls "Gray Market".The issue with Gray market is the following: "Nikon Inc. USA cannot provide any technical support or warranty service on Gray Market items. Additionally Nikon Inc. USA cannot perform any fee-based repair work on Gray Market items. Please do not contact Nikon Inc. USA for help with any Gray Market products. Please contact the reseller or importer of your Gray Market items for warranty and service information as well as software updates and downloads"I sent an email through Amazon asking for a clarification and the vendor 6Ave sent me this response: "Thank you for your email. When shopping on ebay the item may be either or if the listing details do not specify specifically USA. In this case we have not specified USA in the listing and will ship which ever model is available at the time your order is placed. It is not possible to make a specific request. Models that are not covered by the manufacture warranty will be covered by our store warranty for 90 days labor and 1 year parts."1st they are assuming that I purchased the product through "ebay" regardless the fact that they are using the Amazon messaging service. This says a lot about the level of attention to details :(2nd the vendor argues that they didn't specify USA in the listing details and this is correct as the Amazon page hasn't any reference to USA3rd the vendor is assuming that Nikon will provide a guarantee and "Models that are not covered by the manufacture warranty will be covered by our store warranty for 90 days labor and 1 year parts" however there is not any legal document included in the box that certifies this, so far what I have is this email4th I do believe vendors needs to disclose this type of information "Gray Market" because Nikon products (SW, Bios, etc) are updated frequently and I am not entitled to get anything unless the store sends it to me which is something that is not going to happenTo what point Amazon is aware or even worse "endorses" this type of business practices?I acquired all my Nikon products (lenses, accessories, etc) through Amazon so this is the first time that I run into this situation :(Really disappointed with this purchase :(*** Nov 4th Update ***Per peers' feedback (Thanks folks) I am changing my rating from 1 star to 4 stars as this model is great and does exactly what is described in the tech spec. Good purchase and loving the new features (I owned a D40 before) so price/value ratio is positive.

Reviews.Title: Very good item
Reviews.Author: Carlos Berrios
Reviews.Content: Item well packed and protected, almost new.  It has been working great since I bought it. It is a fine model, easy to work with for amateurs and professionals.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Sachin
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I've ever owned. The pictures are awesome and the best part is it is very easy to hold even with small hands

Reviews.Title: Great Communication/Very Quick Delivery
Reviews.Author: Richard Harris "photord"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera body. I do know  this is a great one. I have not used it yet,however,I am confident that I will not have a problem. Again, I would definitely buy from this seller again. i need to add in that the price was quite reasonable

Reviews.Title: Love the upgrade from the d3000
Reviews.Author: sadubay
Reviews.Content: Arrived pretty fast and have already used it a lot! Love it. I upgraded from my damaged D3000 so I am still learning the new gagets.

Reviews.Title: Perfect replacement for my D40x
Reviews.Author: Charlene Greene "cortten"
Reviews.Content: The shutter froze in my D40x and I don't live near a camera repair shop, the cost of shipping it to one, paying a minimum of $130 to have it looked at and maybe repaired and having tho pay shipping to get it back made me look for a new camera body that would fit my lenses.  This was the ticket and I got a body with 14 Mp vs 10 on my old camera, plus a movie mode,  it has an instructional guide in the camera which is very helpful, so it was a nice step up.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: It delivers a great product either mode you pick, fast or slow! Great for the amateur as well as professional!

Reviews.Title: battery door
Reviews.Author: Kelli Cable
Reviews.Content: The battery door comes open sometimes. & i have to keep it closed with my finger. But overall is good.

Reviews.Title: Feature rich
Reviews.Author: Rick Violette
Reviews.Content: I went from a D40 to the D3100 ...and it was like a caveman in Star Trek.  This camera can do so much for me.  Instead of having to spend a lot of time setting this and that, I can concentrate on the composition of the photo.  I really like that.  Love my Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Nikon D3100, cannot recommend enough
Reviews.Author: Michael H. Glassman "Scarlet knight"
Reviews.Content: I own a Sony point and shoot and a Nikon D600, but for the best combination of lightness for travel, image quality and ease of use, the Nikon D3100 is the winner. As an intermediate photographer, I avoided it because I thought it was for beginners. I was wrong. Highly recommend to anyone who wants SLR quality in a small camera body. I take it everywhere!

Reviews.Title: My Best friend when out and about...
Reviews.Author: Froggie
Reviews.Content: Almost everytime i am going outside i always get the urge to take along my D3100 with me because you never know when you get that perfect shot. The video and still images you see upfront with the D3100 is shocking and you seem to fall in love with this camera and never get bored especially with all the features you have to explore.Good job Nikon...PS I NEED TO ENHANCE MY LIMITED CAMERA SKILLS BY JOINING A PHOTO CLASS TO IMPROVE MY HOBBIE.

Reviews.Title: Reliable. Resilient. Functional.
Reviews.Author: Angus Sheehan
Reviews.Content: This is my first d/SLR. So far, I've been very happy with my photographic results. The on-board RAW editing and video trimming reduce the amount of housekeeping I'd normally do in post on a desktop. WB is the only feature I have set to Auto and it's very accurate in most scenarios.I really have only two complaints:1.) No manual mode for video (although, you can use a flashlight to adjust the exposure and then lock it.)2.) The LCD screen lights up when I'm adjusting exposure in the viewfinder's HUD.Also, I feel it worthy to mention that this camera has survived outdoor shoots in torrential rain.

Reviews.Title: great camera for beginner
Reviews.Author: Daniel Nguyen
Reviews.Content: got this for my aunt.  it's light weight, and easty to use.  great image quality when shoot at low iso.

Reviews.Title: Nice upgrade from D70s
Reviews.Author: Mike Grier "Über-geek"
Reviews.Content: We've been using a D70s since it came out for our DSLR action and it was time to upgrade.The D3100 is a great body; unfortunately one lens I have the Nikkor 50mm F/1.8 AF lens does not autofocus since this body needs the AF-S lenses but otherwise our existing investment in glass is preserved.The unit is smaller and lighter than the D70s was and the improved picture quality is very noticeable.The Ken Rockwell site still recommends this model unless you're a professional, I'm glad I followed his recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Nikok 3100
Reviews.Author: Rustyduck
Reviews.Content: As an entry level SLR, I find it to be very satisfactory...I feel it could be a little faster when it comes to storing a slow shutter speed shot...it seem to take longer than the time the shutter was open to store the pic...

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Seann
Reviews.Content: Nikon makes a good camera. The metering system is spot on.. my only complaint is that it focuses too slow.. Action photos of a dog jumping for his ball were very difficult to get.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Gearold McCoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera works in all types of conditions very good starter for a beginner photographer, I would definitely recommend getting the 18-105 lens rather than the kit lens that comes in the kit package.

Reviews.Title: Big bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Kotschenko "If it is too GOOD it is mostly no...
Reviews.Content: I own 2 Nikon D-3100 cameras.I have used them extensively most of the time for still pictures, but also have done some incredible videos with its great capabilities.I haven't had problems with any one of them and life expectancy as far as now, is great.From this camera, I will junp straight to the D-800, the reason: from DX to FX format, as my work becomes better and better day by day and my income grows little by little.You can't miss having this handy product in your hands, no matter if amateur, semi-pro or simple enthusiast, willing to use the full extent of quality in one very small package.Lenses used:50 mm 1.8 AF-S16/85  3.5/5.6 AF-S VR24/70 AF-S  2.8 VR70/300 AF-S 2.5/5.5 VRSigma 150/500 HSM etc...etc....for Nikon cameras.Many other AF lenses with manual focus as they don't have the motor in the lens (SWM).I agree it is and entry level camera, I hope I had this entry level marvel before.I give 4 stars to it, because nothing is perfect in life, other than our kids.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Semi-Professional Camera
Reviews.Author: Lance
Reviews.Content: While the stock lens that comes with the D3100 kit is great, I preferred a faster 2.8 lens.  I purchased the body alone and then purchased two lenses separately.  As far as the camera, it is the perfect mid-point camera for someone who wants to step up their photography but doesn't want to to spend thousands of dollars.  Combined with Lightroom 4, I get really great results.  People think I have a super expensive professional camera... but it's just Nikon's entry-level DSLR.  If you know what you are doing, you can really get a lot out of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Accessories from D3000 don't fit this - beware
Reviews.Author: A. Peters
Reviews.Content: I only needed a new body and had lenses, batteries and chargers for the D3000.  The lenses fit but don't seem to work on auto focus. The batteries and charger were not compatible, so I had to purchase these too.  Had I known about all of this I would have purchased a package deal of a new D3000 for nearly the same price I paid for this.  Also had to buy a manual to try to learn how to use it. It is quite different from the D3000.

Reviews.Title: not as big a savings as you think
Reviews.Author: Tania Henderson
Reviews.Content: So, no frills just bubble wrapped body, no manual, no box, no battery, memory card info or suggestions.  I thought I was saving but the extra research time & battery/memory card I wish I just got a kit.
